definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: There are many art galleries and ongoing displays on the campus of the University of Victoria (UVic).
sentences.chinese: 在维多利亚大学的校园有许多画廊和正在进行的画展。

sentences.english: He also thanked the exhibition's organising committee headed by Mr John Man and Mrs Irene So.
sentences.chinese: 他并多谢画展的筹委会共同主席文锡辉及苏潘慕洁。

sentences.english: An exhibition of the ink sketches of Li Keran is held in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 李可染水墨写生画展在北京举办。

sentences.english: The author of this exhibit Junyi Zhang is such an interesting artist.
sentences.chinese: 此次画展的作者张君义，即是这样一位有趣的艺术家。

sentences.english: Prof. Jackson's personal picture exhibition is housed (v. ) in that building.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊教授的个人画展设在那座楼里。

sentences.english: Up to the 20th of May about 500 people have visited the art exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 截至5月20日有近500人看了画展。

sentences.english: After returning home she held solo exhibitions many times in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 回国后多次在上海举行个人油画展。

sentences.english: We go to an exhibition of chinese painting at the museum.
sentences.chinese: 我们去博物馆参观中国画展。

sentences.english: In 2001, China held the Strait three exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 2001年，举办中国海峡两岸三地画展。

sentences.english: "Beyond the Door of Art " Printmaking Exhibition, The Peninsula Art Museum, Shanghai, China , 2007
sentences.chinese: “门里门外”版画展，半岛美术馆，上海，中国。

sentences.english: Zhu Qizhan Chinese Painting Exhibition was held in Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 朱屺瞻国画展在广州举行。

sentences.english: "Cross the Border" Printmaking Exhibition, The Angle Gallery, Shanghai, China , 2007
sentences.chinese: “门里门外”版画展，半岛美术馆，上海，中国。

sentences.english: Monthly meeting, Pre-exhibition discussion, Art movie show time TECOH (CCC)
sentences.chinese: 月会，画展前讨论，放映艺术电影。

sentences.english: This is a one-man show of paintings whose theme was the vulgarity of modern life.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个以现代生活的庸俗为主题的个人画展。

sentences.english: In 1992 Hongkong is held at the spring exhibition of" peony".
sentences.chinese: 1992年赴香港举办个展“迎春牡丹画展”。

sentences.english: In 2001, he held a personal exhibition in Baiying city Gansu province.
sentences.chinese: 2001年在甘肃白银市举办个人画展。

definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
